headline: Dominion Energy Wins Bid to Resume Wind Project Trump Halted
summary: The ruling marks the third time this week that an offshore wind project was allowed to resume despite a government stop-work order.  US District Judge Jamar Walker in Norfolk, Virginia, issued a preliminary injunction Friday blocking the Interior Department from enforcing its order after Dominion claimed it was losing millions of dollars every day the project sits idle.

headline: U.S. District Court grants preliminary injunction allowing Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project to resume work
summary: RICHMOND, Va., January 16, 2026--Today the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia granted Dominion Energy’s request for a preliminary injunction allowing construction to resume on the Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind (CVOW) project while Dominion Energy’s lawsuit challenging the agency’s action proceeds. Our team will now focus on safely restarting work to ensure CVOW begins delivery of critical energy in just weeks. While our legal challenge proceeds, we will continue seeking a

headline: PPL Outperforms Its Industry in the Last Month: How to Play the Stock?
summary: PPL stock gains 4% in a month, outpacing its peers as clean energy investments and rising demand in the service area fuel investor interest.
